Simple comes before easy – but you still want both. While most Javascript frameworks are moving to frontend development, Grimwire is purely server-side. This constraint allows Grimwire to make decisions for its programs: how their responses should be interpreted, how they compose, how they share resources, and how they're kept secure.

A strong design gets the most value out of the least effort. Grimwire's stateless server programs are easy to maintain and deliver increasing value in an ecosystem of integrated pieces. The measure of a good app in Grimwire is how well it can bend.

Server-side-only doesn't mean dumb UIs. Grimwire provides a toolset for building rich real-time UIs without violating REST principles. As a result, most tools available to local servers are available to remote servers as well – the only difference is latency!

As Grimwire evolves, your applications will as well. New technologies like WebRTC, gesture recognition, and head-mounted displays will fundamentally change how we interact with computers. Grimwire is dedicated to pushing those technologies forward and fostering an ecosystem of FOSS around them.
